metadata.title: CVE-2018-10923 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
It was found that the "mknod" call derived from mknod(2) can create filespointing to devices on a glusterfs server node. An authenticated attackercould use this to create an arbitrary device and read data from any deviceattached to the glusterfs server node.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10923` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glusterfs-client - 4.1.4-1
glusterfs-common - 4.1.4-1
glusterfs-server - 4.1.4-1
libgfapi0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfchangelog0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfrpc0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfxdr0 - 4.1.4-1
libglusterd0 - 4.1.4-1
libglusterfs0 - 4.1.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glusterfs package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.4-1').
